pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a single simp lemma stating that for  `α : ι → Type*` and `(s : Set (Σ i, α i))`, we have `univ.sigma (fun i ↦ Sigma.mk i ⁻¹' s) = s`. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [862b77f530](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14961/commits/862b77f530f7cb40a5600206dc3bae71876de1f7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ univ_sigma_preimage`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Why do you need this lemma? Can you use `Set.sigma Set.univ f` instead of the union? BTW, could you please add a lemma saying that `Set.sigma` is equal to the indexed union of images?

> Why do you need this lemma? Can you use `Set.sigma Set.univ f` instead of the union? BTW, could you please add a lemma saying that `Set.sigma` is equal to the indexed union of images?

ah, I hadn't realized the uses of `Set.sigma` for this application. I'll close the PR - thanks!

> > Why do you need this lemma? Can you use `Set.sigma Set.univ f` instead of the union? BTW, could you please add a lemma saying that `Set.sigma` is equal to the indexed union of images?
> 
> ah, I hadn't realized the uses of `Set.sigma` for this application. I'll close the PR - thanks!

Scratch that - I've reopened! It turns out that the equivalent lemma with better spelling was also missing.

:v: apnelson1 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10051013071/job/27779887090)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10051013071/job/27779886926)
@apnelson1 did you trigger the merge? What happened here?
I replied bors r+ before noticing the actual comments. I'll quickly PR to address them.
Ah okay. Over on the reviewers chat we were a bit concerned that the PR had merged itself!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

a little more readable as
```suggestion
    (univ : Set ι).sigma (fun i ↦ Sigma.mk i ⁻¹' s) = s :=
```

```suggestion
@[simp] theorem univ_sigma_preimage_mk (s : Set (Σ i, α i)) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Set/Sigma): univ sigma preimage eq self
